N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 6659.5 - Application procedure

State Regulations
(a) The director shall approve any
application which meets the requirements of this Part and all other
requirements established by law. (b) A municipality shall submit an original
application, and three copies, to the State Office for the Aging prior to the
start of the program period in the manner and form prescribed by the director, and shall send an informational copy to the area agency(s) on aging that serves
the area of such municipality. At a minimum, such application shall include the
following information: (1)
the name, address, county of location and type of municipality of the sponsoring body; (2)
the name, title and phone number of the
municipal official authorized to sign claims and receive payments; (3)
the total budget, State aid requested and
local share for the program proposed; (4)
a brief description of the program
services proposed; and
(5)
the
signature of the chief municipal officer of the sponsoring
municipality. (c) In
addition, for programs with a maximum State aid of $1000 or more, shall include
a copy of each program contract. Municipalities which work together on joint
recreation programs with one or more other municipalities shall each submit a
separate application. (d) Where two
or more municipalities join together in an agreement pursuant to section
543(1)(d) of the Executive Law to establish, operate and maintain recreation
programs for the elderly, each municipality shall submit a separate application
consistent with subdivision (a) of this section. (e) The director may subsequently withdraw
approval of an application or may require changes with respect to a previously
approved program upon a finding that a municipality has failed to comply with
applicable laws or regulations, or is operating the program in a manner that is
inconsistent with the approved application. (f) The council may recommend to the director
standards for the approval or disapproval of proposed programs. Notes
